statement.p: In 10 of the last 50 days it rained. How many days did it not rain? days

solution.p: We recall that a percent as a decimal is part/whole. Here that is \displaystyle\frac{{P}}{{50}}={0.1}. We solve for P by multiplying by \displaystyle{50}. \displaystyle{P}={0.1}\cdot{50}={5}. This is the number of days that it rained. We want the non-rainy days which is 50-5=45 We round that as requested to 45.
